metadata.synopsis: Duergar looking at stonework. Gruff sounding but surprisingly sophisticated. He asks you to examine the stonework and responds with his interpretation based on what you tell him

1.speaker: Stonemason Kith
1.text: How peculiar. Smooth face, cobbled edges. They're a sign - they must be.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason Kith facing away from player, looking at rubble.

14.speaker: Stonemason Kith
14.text: A sundweller in these parts? Look here, my top-side friend - I need fresh eyes. And I doubt I'll find fresher.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The stonemason turns to you and addresses you directly.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Fine. What should I be looking at?
51.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

3.speaker: Stonemason Kith
3.text: The rock. The rubble. All of it, if I may be so bold.
3.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

31.speaker: Stonemason Kith
31.text: Take a look. Tell me what you see. And be thorough.
31.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Assess the statue for technique and composition.
72.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *The statue's meandering curves and golden edges stand out against the weathered masonry behind it.*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *The statue's meandering curves and golden edges stand out against the weathered masonry behind it.*

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *Two styles, two eras. The statue was carved from newer stone and erected by late-comers to this ancient fortress.*

33.text: *You consider the differences, but they mean nothing to you.*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *You consider the differences, but they mean nothing to you.*

46.speaker: Player
46.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Boulders and stone bricks of various sizes clutter the corridor, many split cleanly in two. Yet some walls remain fully intact.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Boulders and stone bricks of various sizes clutter the corridor, many split cleanly in two. Yet some walls remain fully intact.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *No quake brought these rocks down - they were smashed through in an instant. Something big charged through here. Something very big.*

36.text: *What this pattern signifies, you can't fathom.*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *What this pattern signifies, you can't fathom.*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Survey the area for unseen curiosities.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *Several glassy stones stand out in the debris. Their borders are coated with tiny yellow crystals.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Several glassy stones stand out in the debris. Their borders are coated with tiny yellow crystals.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *The hottest of flames smoothed the stone and left sulphuric crystals behind. The fires of the Hells have touched Grymforge.*

30.speaker: Player
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Try to remember the tome 'Fables of Forges Grym'.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *You recall the tale of a Sharran fortress armed with impenetrable adamantine - a metal created by a gnomish mage.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You recall the tale of a Sharran fortress armed with impenetrable adamantine - a metal created by a gnomish mage.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *There was also whispers of the gnome's secret project - an invincible guardian - though its existence was never proven.*

86.text: *The book's style was not particularly gripping, and as such, its contents are tough to remember.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *The book's style was not particularly gripping, and as such, its contents are tough to remember.*

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I know everything about this place. In fact, it was hand-forged by a flumph called Grym...
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

76.speaker: Stonemason Kith
76.text: *The duergar listens to your tall tale. Though sceptical of the more suspect details, they seem amused enough by the story.*
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *The duergar listens to your tall tale. Though sceptical of the more suspect details, they seem amused enough by the story.*
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

39.speaker: Stonemason Kith
39.text: Fascinating... What begat such a powerful flumph? Does it still live here to this day?

58.speaker: Stonemason Kith
58.text: How exactly does a flumph hand-forge anything?

42.text: I prefer evidence, hard as stone. Look again, what can you see before you?

93.speaker: Stonemason Kith
93.text: I prefer evidence, hard as stone. Look again, what can you see before you?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You don't talk like the rest of your crew. Fancy britches, are you?

6.speaker: Stonemason Kith
6.text: There is nothing fancy about good work. Respect the stone, or it may crush you.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Recite the tale you remembered from your reading.

15.speaker: Stonemason Kith
15.text: How fascinating. I told my kinfolk that book-learning has its benefits.

19.speaker: Stonemason Kith
19.text: A crafty gnome helping forge a fortress that would last an aeon.  Mythic metal atop stone hewn by the devoted.

21.speaker: Stonemason Kith
21.text: That's to say nothing of this tale of an invulnerable protector - it's unfortunate the Sharran's successors found no proof.

82.speaker: Stonemason Kith
82.text: Doesn't explain this infernal plate I found, though. Here, take it, perhaps you'll be able to figure it out why it's here.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I am ready to report my observations.

84.speaker: Stonemason Kith
84.text: Incredible - an entire history, risen from dirt and debris! Picture it:

64.speaker: Stonemason Kith
64.text: An ancient city, hewn from the stone by disciples of Shar, later abandoned.

26.speaker: Stonemason Kith
26.text: Untold centuries later, a new tribe revives it. Fresh walls, fresh sculptures...

17.speaker: Stonemason Kith
17.text: ... until a great hellbeast charges through, toppling the walls and crushing the people!

87.speaker: Stonemason Kith
87.text: Heh - that explains the infernal plate I found. Perhaps you might have use of it.

70.speaker: Stonemason Kith
70.text: But my work has only begun. There is more still to find. I must get to it!

62.speaker: Stonemason Kith
62.text: Yes, the rubble - it was a great beast that tore these walls down. I should have known.

85.speaker: Stonemason Kith
85.text: The statue is newer than the fortress, you say? So obvious in hindsight.

94.speaker: Stonemason Kith
94.text: Sulphur. Of course! The rocks have been altered by hellfire.

59.speaker: Stonemason Kith
59.text: Alas, you've left me with more questions than answers. My survey continues.

74.speaker: Player
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason gestures to his own eyes.

29.speaker: Stonemason Kith
29.text: Peering into cracks and crevasses in hope to find history's morsels.

37.speaker: Stonemason Kith
37.text: I have come up regrettably short. I hope you might see truths where I cannot.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: A friendly welcome? A rarity in the Underdark.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason gestures to his own eyes.

40.speaker: Stonemason Kith
40.text: Ease your suspicions - I've got no mind for slaving. My passion is stone, and my god is the chisel.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason gestures to his own eyes.

45.speaker: Stonemason Kith
45.text: But these learned eyes reach their limits. And so I must humbly request yours.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason gestures to his own eyes.

78.speaker: Stonemason Kith
78.text: As rare as a smile in Sschindylryn, you might say. But I've no skill for slaving - I prefer chisel to cane.

8.speaker: Stonemason Kith
8.text: The past is nearer than we think. We simply must dig.

28.speaker: Stonemason Kith
28.text: Please - a quick look, if you don't mind.

49.speaker: Stonemason Kith
49.text: The True Soul, the battle - too many distractions. There is still truth to uncover.
